hear ： 及物动词，指声音进入耳内，但不含有注意的意味，即，只要听觉正常，声音进入耳内，就能听见。但在祈使句中，hear可指有意识的行为。
listen ： 不及物动词，指有意识地倾听，强调行为的过程。
overhear ： 指偶然听到，无意中听到，也指偷听。

sentences.en: The deaf do not hear at all.
sentences.cn: 聋子根本听不见声音。

sentences.cn: 我听到门开了。

sentences.en: I often hear him singing.
sentences.cn: 我常听见他唱歌。

sentences.en: I heard my name called.
sentences.cn: 我听到有人叫我的名字。

sentences.en: We've heard that you would graduate soon.
sentences.cn: 我们听说你很快就要毕业了。

sentences.en: Have you heard why she did so?
sentences.cn: 你听说过她为什么要这么干吗?

data.mean: hear from sb | hear sth from sb 收到某人的信件（或电子邮件、电话等）；得到某人的消息
sb can (not); help (doing); sth; sb can not help but do sth 某人忍不住做某事；不可能避免某事

sentence.cn: 哦! 听到这个消息我很抱歉。
sentence.en: Oh! I'm sorry to hear that.
sentence.from: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 听力 原文

sentence.cn: 我全家都在听，我的朋友们也在听。
sentence.en: My entire family is hearing,  and so are all my friends.
sentence.from: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 完形填空 原文

jx.jx_en_mean: To get a letter, telephone call, or transmitted communication from.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 收到…的来信、电话或传达来的信息

lj.lj_ly: If you don't do your homework, you're going to hear from me.
lj.lj_ls: 如果你不做家庭作业，我就要批评你

phrase.cizu_name: be unable to hear oneself think

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to complain about very loud noise or music
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)［用于抱怨噪声或音乐声太大］吵得要死

lj.lj_ly: I hate bars where you can't hear yourself think.
lj.lj_ls: 我讨厌酒吧，那里吵得要死。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to express one's wholehearted agreement, especially with something said in a speech
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［用于表示衷心同意某人所说的话］听啊！听啊！

phrase.cizu_name: hear say (或 tell) of (或 that)

lj.lj_ly: I heard tell that he went out west.

entry.def: When you hear a sound, you become aware of it through your ears.

example.ex: She heard no further sounds...
example.tran: 她再没有听到别的声音了。

example.ex: The trumpet can be heard all over their house...
example.tran: 喇叭声整栋房子都能听见。

entry.def: If you hear something such as a lecture or a piece of music, you listen to it.

example.ex: You can hear commentary on the match in about half an hour's time...
example.tran: 大约半小时后就能听到这场比赛的解说了。

example.ex: I don't think you've ever heard Doris talking about her emotional life before...
example.tran: 我想你以前从未听过多丽丝谈自己的感情生活。

entry.def: If you say that you can hear someone saying something, you mean that you are able to imagine hearing it.

example.ex: Can't you just hear John Motson now?...
example.tran: 你脑海里现在没有响起约翰·莫特森的声音吗？

example.ex: 'I was hot,' I could still hear Charlotte say with her delicious French accent.
example.tran: “我很热，”夏洛特那带有甜美法国口音的话语仍在我的脑际盘旋。

entry.def: When a judge or a court of law hears a case, or evidence in a case, they listen to it officially in order to make a decision about it.
entry.tran: （法官或法庭）审理（案件），听取（证词）

example.ex: The jury have heard evidence from defence witnesses...
example.tran: 陪审团已经听取了辩方证人的证词。

example.ex: He had to wait months before his case was heard.
example.tran: 等了数月后，他的案子才得到审理。

entry.def: If you hear from someone, you receive a letter or telephone call from them.

example.ex: Drop us a line, it's always great to hear from you...
example.tran: 给我们写封短信，能收到你的信总是让人很高兴。

example.ex: The police are anxious to hear from anyone who may know her.
example.tran: 警方急切地希望任何可能认识她的人打电话来。

entry.def: In a debate or discussion, if you hear from someone, you listen to them giving their opinion or information.
entry.tran: （辩论或讨论中）倾听（意见或情况）

example.ex: What are you hearing from people there?
example.tran: 你在那里都听到人们说了些什么？

entry.def: If you hear some news or information about something, you find out about it by someone telling you, or from the radio or television.

example.ex: My mother heard of this school through Leslie...
example.tran: 我母亲是从莱斯利那里知道这所学校的。

example.ex: ...the rumours I've been hearing about for years...
example.tran: 多年来我一直听说的一些谣言

entry.def: If you have heard of something or someone, you know about them, but not in great detail.

example.ex: Many people haven't heard of reflexology.
example.tran: 很多人没听说过反射学。

example.ex: ...people who, maybe, had hardly heard the word till a year or two ago.
example.tran: 那些可能直到一两年前才听说这个词的人们

entry.def: If you say that you have heard something before, you mean that you are not interested in it, or do not believe it, or are not surprised about it, because you already know about it or have experienced it.

example.ex: Furness shrugs wearily. He has heard it all before...
example.tran: 弗内斯疲倦地耸了耸肩。这事他早就全知道了。

example.ex: 'How many times have I heard that before?' Merchant complained angrily.
example.tran: “我听过有多少次了？”麦钱特生气地抱怨道。

entry.def: If you say 'Do you hear?' or 'Did you hear me?' to someone, you are telling them in an angry or forceful way to pay attention to what you are saying.
entry.tran: “听见没有？”“你听到我的话了吗？”（要求对方注意听自己的话）

example.ex: If you don't get out I'll call the police. Do you hear?...
example.tran: 如果你不出去，我就要报警了。听见没有？

example.ex: Leave her alone! Do you hear me?
example.tran: 别惹她！听见了吗？

entry.def: During political debates and public meetings, people sometimes say 'Hear hear!' to express their agreement with what the speaker is saying.
entry.tran: 说得对！说得好！（政治辩论或公众大会上对讲话人表示赞同的喝彩声）

entry.def: If you say that you can't hear yourself think, you are complaining and emphasizing that there is a lot of noise, and that it is disturbing you or preventing you from doing something.

example.ex: For God's sake shut up. I can't hear myself think!...
example.tran: 看在老天爷的份上，闭嘴吧。吵死我了！

example.ex: If you're sitting in the front yard, you can't hear yourself think because the traffic is getting very, very bad.
example.tran: 如果你坐在前院，就会被吵死，因为外面交通太混乱了。

entry.def: If you say that you won't hear of someone doing something, you mean that you refuse to let them do it.

example.ex: I've always wanted to be an actor but Dad wouldn't hear of it...
example.tran: 我一直想当个演员，但爸爸不同意。

example.ex: He even thought about moving from the village. But his friends wouldn't hear of it.
example.tran: 他甚至考虑要从村子里搬出去。但他的朋友们不答应。

means.word_mean: 2. get to know or become aware of, usually accidentally;

sentences.sentence: "I learned that she has two grown-up children"
"I see that you have been promoted"

means.word_mean: 3. examine or hear (evidence or a case) by judicial process;

sentences.sentence: "The jury had heard all the evidence"
"The case will be tried in California"
"We heard nothing from our son for five years"
"We must hear the expert before we make a decision"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hīeran, hēran, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch hooren and German hören

means: high erucic acid rapeseed 高芥酸油菜籽
Hospital Emergency Administrative Radio 医院急救行政无线电电台
human error analysis record 人为差错分析记录

sentences.cn: 你昨晚收听了那出广播剧吗？
sentences.en: Did you hear that play on the radio last night?

sentences.cn: 有人听见她威胁她先前的恋人。
sentences.en: She has been heard to make threats to her former lover.

sentences.cn: 难道你没有听到我的话？
sentences.en: Didn't you hear what I said?

sentences.cn: 你听到他出去了吗？
sentences.en: Did you hear him go out?

sentences.cn: 她听到背后有脚步声。
sentences.en: She heard footsteps behind her.

sentences.cn: 他听得到狗叫。
sentences.en: He could hear a dog barking.

sentences.cn: 我听觉不太好。
sentences.en: I can't hear very well.

sentences.cn: 他甚至考虑要从村子里搬出去。但他的朋友们不答应。
sentences.en: He even thought about moving from the village. But his friends wouldn't hear of it.

sentences.cn: 看在老天爷的份上，闭嘴吧。吵死我了！
sentences.en: For God's sake shut up. I can't hear myself think!...

sentences.cn: 别惹她！听见了吗？
sentences.en: Leave her alone! Do you hear me?

sentences.cn: 如果你不出去，我就要报警了。听见没有？
sentences.en: If you don't get out I'll call the police. Do you hear?...

sentences.cn: “我听过有多少次了？”麦钱特生气地抱怨道。
sentences.en: 'How many times have I heard that before?' Merchant complained angrily.

sentences.cn: 弗内斯疲倦地耸了耸肩。这事他早就全知道了。
sentences.en: Furness shrugs wearily. He has heard it all before...

sentences.en: 'I was hot,' I could still hear Charlotte say with her delicious French accent.

sentences.en: Can't you just hear John Motson now?...

sentences.en: The last I heard of him he was living in Glasgow.

sentences.cn: 从我所听到的来看，事情进展不错。
sentences.en: Things are going well from what I hear .

sentences.en: While admiring the new building, I heard someone calling my name.

sentences.cn: 很高兴又能听到你的声音.

sentences.en: I heard the tramp of the marching soldiers.

sentences.en: In the distance he hears the screech of a dump truck's brakes.

sentences.en: When I hear that flute I can't help fearing. I'll go the same road as he.

sentences.en: I could hear my father bumbling about downstairs.

sentences.cn: 接着我听见敲门声,鄂榭走了进来.
sentences.en: Then I heard a knock on my door and Usher came in.

sentences.cn: 13众百姓都要听见害怕 、 不再擅敢行事.
sentences.en: All the people will hear and be afraid, and will not be contemptuous again.

sentences.cn: 他深深陷入幻想,连门铃声都没听见.
sentences.en: He was so lost in reverie that he did not hear the doorbell ring.

sentences.en: I could hear him chuckling to himself as he read that funny story.

sentences.en: And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice, but seeing no man.

sentences.en: Hast thou heard the secret of God and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?

sentences.en: Miss Bold had heard Mr. Slope say he had something pressing to say to Eleanor.

sentences.en: “About once a week, I have a client that will bring up a new certification I’ve never even heard of and I’m in this industry,” said Kevin Wilhelm, chief executive officer of Sustainable Business Consulting.

sentences.en: All we hear is that the board is undecided about how to proceed.

sentences.cn: 控制塔上的官员得知这一消息后,非常气愤.

sentences.cn: 得知这个消息,人们震惊了.

sentences.en: Myra broke into tears when she heard that her husband had been injured in an accident.

sentences.cn: 得知这个消息,他暴跳起来.
sentences.en: He jumped up to the ceiling on hearing the news.

sentences.cn: 我惊讶地得知,他赞同工人们的观点.

sentences.cn: 得知您荣升高位,非常高兴.
sentences.en: Very pleased to hear of your promotion.

sentences.en: My father went straight up in the air when he heard I damaged the car.

sentences.cn: 得知你轻松通过了考试,十分振奋.
sentences.en: I'm so exciting to hear that you passed the exam easily.

sentences.cn: 我看见他得知那个消息时,脸色一下子变了.
sentences.en: I watched his face change color as he heard the news.

sentences.cn: 得知他去世的消息, 我催心剖肝.
sentences.en: On hearing the news of his death, I was deeply grieved.

sentences.cn: 此后我从他那里得知情况并非如此.
sentences.en: I afterwards heard from him that this was not the case.

sentences.cn: 现在我们得知了一个医学名称.
sentences.en: Now we are hearing a medical name.

sentences.cn: 得知这一情况之后,控制塔的一位官员怎么说?
sentences.en: What did the officer in the control tower say after he heard the news?

sentences.cn: 得知她去世的消息时, 一股冰冷透骨的疼痛刺穿了我空荡荡的心.
sentences.en: When I heard about her death, a chilling pain pierced my empty heart.

sentences.cn: 她得知这一消息时脸上现出一种明亮的光彩.
sentences.en: Her face cleared up when she heard the news.

sentences.cn: 陪审团已经听取了辩方证人的证词。
sentences.en: The jury have heard evidence from defence witnesses...

sentences.cn: 法院在听取了所有的论据后才休庭.
sentences.en: The court sat until all the arguments had been heard.

sentences.cn: 他们还设立贸易法庭以直接听取该委员会的控诉.
sentences.en: They also established a Commerce Court to hear appeals directly from the Commission.

sentences.cn: 大会听取了一名来自一个比较贫困地区的代表的呼籲.
sentences.en: The conference heard an appeal from a representative from one of the more deprived areas.

sentences.cn: 布什表示立法者应在听取这个报告后再做判决.
sentences.en: Mr Bush says legislators should withhold judgement until they have heard it.

sentences.cn: 下面我想听取出席会议的每位先生的意见.
sentences.en: Next, we'd like to hear the comments from everyone present at the meeting.

sentences.cn: 没有人听取她们的意见.
sentences.en: Their voices are not being heard.

sentences.cn: 人民代表大会还接受人民的来信和来访,直接听取人民的意见和要求.
sentences.en: The National People's Congress hears opinions and receives demands directly from visiting people or through letters.
sentences.from: 汉英非文学 - 白皮书

sentences.cn: 我们亦很乐意听取您对赞助形式的各种提议.
sentences.en: We are also open to hear any that you have on the format of sponsorship.

sentences.cn: 法庭听取了那个女孩指控的细节,曾是应召女郎的她与被告有染.
sentences.en: A court has heard details of a former call girl's alleged sexual relationship with the accused.

sentences.cn: 法院听取了指纹专家的证词.
sentences.en: The court heard evidence from a fingerprint expert.

sentences.cn: 中国人民银行及其分支机构应当听取申请人、利害关系人的意见.
sentences.en: The PBC or its branch institutions shall hear the opinions of applicant or the interested party.

sentences.cn: 会议还听取了关于诊断癌症新方法的报告.
sentences.en: The conference also heard reports on improved methods of diagnosing cancers.

sentences.cn: 如果不适当听取青年音乐家们的心声,世间的情况就会变糟.
sentences.en: The world will be a poorer place if younger musicians aren't given a proper hearing.

sentences.cn: 我听取几个报告关于他接受金钱没有派出商品.
sentences.en: I have heard a few reports about him accepting money without sending out merchandise.

sentences.cn: 我们就从听取各委员会成员的报告开始.
sentences.en: We'll open by hearing from each committee member.

sentences.cn: 众议院发言人NP表示她感谢总统可以花时间听取他们的意见.
sentences.en: House Speaker NP said she appreciates that the president took the time to hear their views.

sentences.cn: 你还得检验一下,假如不听取潜在消费者的意见,不管什么品牌都无法进入市场.
sentences.en: Now test it: No brand reaches the market without hearing from potential consumers.

sentences.cn: 法庭今天下午听取证词.
sentences.en: The court is hearing evidence this afternoon.

sentences.cn: 我召集了国会特别会议听取你的意见.
sentences.en: I've called for a special session of the senate to hear your position.

sentences.cn: 法官听取双方的申诉.
sentences.en: The judge gave both sides a hearing.

sentences.cn: 安娜克萨瑞忒, 你胜利了,不必再听取我的恳求了.
sentences.en: Anaxarete, you have conquered and shall no longer have to hear my importunities.

sentences.cn: 法庭听取了双方律师的陈述.
sentences.en: The court heard counsel for both sides.

sentences.cn: 但在判决宣告前应当听取被告人的最后陈述意见.
sentences.en: However, before the judgment is pronounced, the final statement of the defendant shall be heard.

sentences.cn: 法官和陪审团听取了双方的证词.
sentences.en: The judge and jury hear all the evidence given by both sides.

sentences.cn: 吉姆,我很乐意听取你的意见, 但我们先等艾美讲完好 吗 ?
sentences.en: I'd like to hear your input, Jim, but how about we wait until Amy gets through?

sentences.cn: 他们还听取了一个关于诊断癌症新方法的报告.
sentences.en: They also heard a lecture on improved methods of diagnosing cancers.

sentences.cn: 阿西娜听取了双方的申诉.
sentences.en: Athena hears both sides.

sentences.cn: 迈凯轮已要求将听取在下周的扩散上诉聆讯在巴黎.
sentences.en: McLaren has asked to be heard at next week's diffuser appeal hearing in Paris.

sentences.cn: 法官认为听取这个上诉是不明智的.
sentences.en: The judge deemed it inadvisable to hear the appeal.

sentences.cn: 这件上诉案不公开审理。
sentences.en: The appeal was heard in private.

sentences.cn: 等了数月后，他的案子才得到审理。
sentences.en: He had to wait months before his case was heard.

sentences.cn: 当律师分争论程序问题时,审理被停止.
sentences.en: The hearing was held up while counsel argued over procedural problems.

sentences.cn: 审理暂停了两周.
sentences.en: The hearing has been suspended for two weeks.

sentences.cn: 他们申请早日审理他们的案子.
sentences.en: They filed an application to have their case heard early.

sentences.cn: 每个巡回上诉法院负责审理本区内地区法院的上诉.
sentences.en: Each circuit court of appeals hears appeals from all the district courts located within its area.

sentences.cn: 成立了一个仲裁委员会以按照仲裁规则审理和裁决该争端.
sentences.en: An arbitration board was formed to hear and decide the dispute according the rules of arbitration.

sentences.cn: 该案被秘密审理.
sentences.en: The case is heard in camera.

sentences.cn: 案子审理于星期一下午重新开始.
sentences.en: The hearing reopens on Monday afternoon.

sentences.cn: 平顶山市中级人民法院在汝州开庭审理其中一名犯罪嫌疑人张三有.
sentences.en: The Pingdingshan Intermediate people's court in Ruzhou holds court hearing a suspect opens three has.

sentences.cn: 本案由道德法庭审理.
sentences.en: This case will be heard in a moral court.

sentences.cn: 该案已被列出供下周审理.
sentences.en: The case is listed to be heard next week.

sentences.cn: 由这样指定的三位仲裁员组成仲裁庭来审理案件.
sentences.en: The three arbitrators so appointed will from an arbitration tribunal to hear the case.

sentences.cn: 抗议者被逐出法庭后审理继续进行.
sentences.en: The hearing proceeded after the protesters were removed from the courtroom.

sentences.cn: 昨天北京法院开庭审理此案.
sentences.en: Beijing court open a court session heard this case yesterday.

sentences.cn: 对该计划决策的上诉,将于下个月审理.
sentences.en: The appeal against the plan decision will be heard next month.

sentences.cn: 如果最高法院拒绝审理这个案件, 那么这种拒绝没有判例效果.
sentences.en: If the Supreme Court refuses to hear a case, such refusal has no precedential effect.

sentences.cn: 第二条人民法院行政审判庭依法审理国际贸易行政案件.
sentences.en: Article 2 The administrative tribunal of a people's court shall hear the international trade administrative cases.

sentences.cn: 人民法院审理民事案件时, 当事人有权进行辩论.
sentences.en: When the People's Court is hearing a civil case, the litigant has the right of debate.

sentences.cn: 法院是否审理案件通常很难预见.
sentences.en: It is often difficult to predict whether the Court will hear a case.

sentences.cn: 法官不马上审理此案件,这太不公正了.
sentences.en: It was unjust of the judge not to hear the case immediately.

sentences.cn: 明天法庭要开庭审理那宗杀人案.
sentences.en: The court is convening tomorrow to hear the murder case.

sentences.cn: 法庭审理了埃利斯贩卖好莱坞大片盗版带的案件.
sentences.en: The court heard that Ellis sold pirated tapes of Hollywood blockbusters.

sentences.cn: 该案已被安排在下周审理.
sentences.en: The case is listed to heard next week.

sentences.cn: 侯耀华争夺其兄侯耀文的遗产案件法院已经立案, 择日将开庭对案件进行审理.
sentences.en: Hou for his brother hou's legacy has been filed election, case court hearing the case.

sentences.cn: 陪审团已审理了所有的证物; 这个案件将在加州审理.
sentences.en: The jury had heard all the evidence; The case will be tried in California.

sentences.cn: 对方当事人不提出答辩状的, 不影响人民法院审理.
sentences.en: Where a litigant does not submit a reply, It'shall not affect the court hearing.

sentences.cn: 不服法院判决的上诉将于下月审理.
sentences.en: The appeal from the court order will be heard next month.

sentences.cn: 哪一位法官审理这案子?
sentences.en: Which judge heard the case?

Sentence.sentence: Where do the seeds of change come from? The Native American Indians have a saying: Pay attention to the whispers so you won't have to hear the screams.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: You may have heard some of the fashion industry horror stories: models eating tissues or cotton balls to hold off hunger, and models collapsing from hunger-induced heart attacks just seconds after they step off the runway.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: One argument that you tend to hear a lot from the pro-tipping crowd seems logical enough: the service is better when waiters depend on tips, presumably because they see a benefit to successfully veiling their contempt for you.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Of course, I had heard that genius could show itself at an early age, so I  was only slightly taken aback that I had achieved perfection at the tender age of 14.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: If you spend much time with educators and policy makers, you'll hear a lot of the following words: standards, results, skills, self-control, accountability, and so on.

Sentence.sentence: I leaned in to hear her: I can't hear you when you shout  at me.

Sentence.sentence: I have heard people say that a writer should never  take criticism personally.

Sentence.sentence: If you hear that yours isn't doing well in math, or see them sitting outside the dean's office, it's like a personal failure.

Sentence.sentence: Those are not the most encouraging words to hear just before eating lunch at one of Hong Kong's smartest British restaurants, Alfie's by KEE, but head chef Neil Tomes has more to say.

Sentence.sentence: That way, you see and hear more: and your mind responds gratefully to the greater amount of wildness in your life.

Sentence.sentence: Every 15 seconds, one group of students heard a bell.

Sentence.sentence: I heard you have moved to a new house in the suburb.
